text: Draught @ SOPP Helsinki 2016. Yellow cloudy colour, no head. No smell. Aroma of butter, weizenbier-like. Yeast and banana. Palate is oily, viscous. No notable carbon. Robust carbon. Surprisingly fresh.

@ SOPP 2016, Helsinki. Pours hazy amber with a little white head. The aroma features sweet banana, juniper and rye - fairly standard for a sahti. Taste has a very rustic vibe to it proving once again that sahti is the antithesis of clean commercial bulk beers; not difficult to believe that a beer like this has been drunk in some regions in Finland for centuries. This sahti is a bit different to others I have had: it starts sweet but surprisingly sweetness fades fairly quickly giving way to bready maltiness and sourness of berries; not much banana. The palate is very thick and full-bodied, flat and sticky. An interesting curiosity among modern beers but I prefer sweeter and not quite as full-bodied sahtis. Had a taste of Mallassahti also and it was tastier in my opinion.

Cask @ St. Urhon Sahtipäivät 2016. Aroma has sweet malty tones and hayish juniper tones. High viscosity. Flavour has sweet fruity tones. Finishes with juniper, biscuits and hayish tones. A bit bitter in a harsh way in the finish - less juniper please!

Tap @HBF 2016. Cloudy dark muddy color. Huge size, yellow head, stays. Banana, nutty, sweet, buttery, rye and juniper in aroma. Sweet, banana, grainy and spicy juniper in taste. Sweet banana and rye in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Pleasant mouthfeel. Absolutely fantastic sahti!
At HBF 2016. Pours smoothy like character. Aroma has banana, wheat, yeast and mild spicy notes. Nice drinkability once you get over the smoothie character. Mild smoke.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 @Helsinki Beer Festival 2016brown hazy. Ripe banana, smokey, malty rye nose. Doughy yeasty, quite nice. Full bodied, chewy porridgy, rye malty, smoke. Nice.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

(Poured from some vessel at HBF2016) The beer poured yelly like, dark brown and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had banana and rye. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were rye, sweetness, banana, juniper and low bitterness. Afteraste had sweetness and rye. A nice rye sahti.
Tap at HBF 2016, Helsinki. Colour is deep cloudy orange with small very small white bubbly head. Aromas and flavors: Sweetness, grain, juniper, strong malts. Heavy stuff.
Very old notes from SOPP 2015: Just numeral and attributes: Huge body, thick, bananas. Best beer so far in Finland.

Draught @ [ SOPP 2015 ] @ Railway Square / Rautatientori, Helsinki, Finland. [ As Lapin Voima Kullero Ruissahti ].Murky medium orange color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, wood - juniper. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet with a long duration, wheat, yeast, baking yeast - dough, wood - juniper notes. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft to flat. [20150723]

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2016 Tap (SOPP2015, Helsinki) (6:4:6:1:11=2.8)
Sahti in a western-Finnish style, at 7-8%, according to the brewer. Gloudy golden marmalade colour, brief head. Really earthy aroma, muddy, even. Jeeez, thats the slimiest palate Ive ever encountered. No crispness, not even wateriness, just pure slickness. Taste is also earthy, with a nice dry peppery spiciness in the finish - thats the best bit. Grassy too, almost mouldy, and so much drying white pepper. Not sure if there are hops in here or not - I sure get the pepperiness of old midget wild hops, but someone said it was just juniper, no hops in the recipe. Odd, and not saying 7%. However, its hard to drink, even oppressive.
Rerate: Tap (HBF2016) (74:7:4:15=3.7) at 8%
Bogus that this should be forced under the same entry as a rerate, the recipe is so different from before. Sahti banana aroma. Thick palate, but pleasant carbonation. Sweetish, light barley breadiness. Finish sweet and grainy. Not particularly saying rye to me, but not saying 8% either.

Medium aroma with honey, juniper and sweet malts. Deep golden color with small/medium natural white head. Ultra-hazy liquid. Strong organic bit stony taste of honey, juniper, bread and malts. Narrow taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with sweet malts. Balanced. Ultra-strong body with low carbonation. Overall bit dull but organic sahti with superb body.
Tap @ sopp. Pours cloudy orange, no head. Juniper, rye in the aroma. Juniper, cellar in the flavor. Really thick mouthfeel, almost chewable.

tap @ SOPP Tampere
Yellow to orange hazy beer with little white head. Aroma is just model airplane glue, maybe slight fruitiness. Flavor has glue, yoghurt, banana and alcohol. Palate is very thick, jellyish. No bitterness. Aftertaste has glue and alcohol. Ive never had a beer with this kind of jellyish palate.

Amber colour, small white head. Aroma is banana, some yeast, toffee, yeast and earthy notes. Flavour is yeast, banana, some bread, mild toffee and a bit toasted notes. The palate of this is just like drinking olive oil or something. One of the oiliest palated beers Ive ever had.
Tap at SOPP Rauma. Hazy amber color, small off-white head. Banana, rubber and smoke in the nose. Full-bodied. Viscosity is ... high. Liquid bread. Banana, some juniper. Heavy Sahti!
